candidates.title: [3.13] gh-140607: Validate returned byte count in RawIOBase.read (GH-140611)
candidates.body:
While `RawIOBase.readinto` should return a count of bytes between 0 and the length of the given buffer, it is not required to. Add validation inside RawIOBase.read() that the returned byte count is valid. (cherry picked from commit 0f0a362768aecb4c791724cce486d8317533a94d)

Most PRs will require an issue number. Trivial changes, like fixing a typo, do not need an issue.

# Backport Pull Request title

If this is a backport PR (PR made against branches other than `main`),
please ensure that the PR title is in the following format:

```
[X.Y] <title from the original PR> (GH-NNNNNN)
```

Where: [X.Y] is the branch name, for example: [3.13].

GH-NNNNNN refers to the PR number from `main`.

-->

* Issue: gh-140607
<!-- /gh-issue-number -->

candidates.title: [3.14] gh-139951: Tests on tuple tracking (GH-140575)
